section.title: rtl/eclrtl
section.para: The rtl/eclrtl directory contains the sources for the eclrtl.so library.

The eclrtl library is primarily the runtime support library for the code generator. Many of the functions it contains are related to processing the different datatypes (e.g., string/int/unicode/datasets/dictionaries). It also contains the functions for regular expressions.

Eclrtl should only contain code that is needed by the code generator - it is not a library for sharing code between the engines. In particular it should not have any activity related code (that should go in thorhelper). All the functions assume that the roxiemem memory manager is being used for allocating rows. This library also shouldn't contain any dependence on dali.
The library is also used by many other libraries in the system primarily for the functions for the system functions and the functions for converting between different datatypes.

One of its goals is to isolate the generated code from other parts of the system and minimize the dependencies. There are two reasons for this -
It allows compiled workunits to remain compatible with future revisions of the platform. This allows the platform to be upgraded withut having to recompile any deployed queries.
It reduces the include file dependencies for the generated code. In particular the header files should not include jlib, icu, boost or any other complex set of includes. It is fine for the implementation to use those libraries, but there should be no direct references in the headers. This reduces the dependencies required on a system and also reduces the compile time.

The following is a summary of the different files, and yes they could do with being rationalized.
eclrtl.cpp - datatype conversion functions, regular expression wrappers, various system functions, hash functions, helper functions for searching tables,
rtldistr.cpp - support classes for DISTRIBUTION
rtlds.cpp - support classes for datasets and dictionaries
rtlfield.cpp - classes for representing the format of fields within records.
rtlint.cpp - functions for reading and writing integers of different lengths
rtlkey.cpp - functions and classes that are used to create keyed filters for the index reads.
rtlqstr.cpp - qstring helper functions.
rtlrank.cpp - support functions for RANK/RANKED
rtlread.cpp - helper functions for creating/reading/accessing serialized rows.
rtlsize.cpp - unused - should possibly be deleted.
rtltype.cpp
rtlxml.cpp - helper functions for generating xml from rows.
